intro: Eriocaulon kunthii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grassy leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in dense spikes, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Eriocaulon kunthii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
